name: Congenital Leptin Receptor Deficiency (CLRD)
chief_complaint: My child is always hungry and gaining weight too fast
prognosis: With early diagnosis and treatment, metabolic complications can be managed but lifelong therapy is required. Without treatment, severe obesity and metabolic syndrome develop.
description: CLRD is an ultra-rare autosomal recessive disorder caused by mutations in the LEPR gene, leading to leptin receptor dysfunction. This results in failure of satiety signaling, severe early-onset obesity, and multiple endocrine abnormalities. The condition mimics simple obesity but has distinct genetic and metabolic features.
risk_factors: Family history of severe childhood obesity
Certain ethnic backgrounds (higher in Pakistani populations)
